create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_1: A Basin can hold Items and Fluids for Processing
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_2: After a processing step, basins try to output below to the side of them
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_3: When a valid component is present, the Basin will show an output faucet
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_4: A number of options are applicable here
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_5: Outputs will be caught by the inventory below
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_6: Without output faucet, the Basin will retain items created in its processing
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_7: This can be useful if outputs should be re-used as ingredients
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_8: Desired outputs will then have to be extracted from the basin
create_brass_coated.ponder.basin.text_9: A Filter might be necessary to avoid pulling out un-processed items
create_brass_coated.ponder.chain_gearshi: Controlling rotational speed with Chain Gearshifts
Unpowered Chain Gearshifts behave exactly like Chain Drives
When Powered, the speed transmitted to other Chain Drives in the row is doubled
Whenever the Powered Gearshift is not at the source, its speed will be halved instead
In both cases, Chain Drives in the row always run at 2x the speed of the Powered Gearshift
Using analog signals, the ratio can be adjusted more precisely between 1 and 2
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer.head: Using the Deployer
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer.text: Given Rotational Force, a Deployer can imitate player interactions
Right-click the front to give it an Item to use
Items can also be inserted automatically
When a filter is set, it activates only while holding a matching item
Only items matching the filter can now be inserted...
...and only non-matching items will be extracted
It will always interact with the position 2 blocks in front of itself
Blocks directly in front will not obstruct it
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer_cont: Whenever Deployers are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
They activate at each visited location, using items from inventories anywhere on the contraption
The Filter slot can be used to specify which items to pull
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer_mode: By default, a Deployer imitates a Right-click interaction
Using a Wrench, it can be set to imitate a Left-click instead
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer_proc: With a fitting held item, Deployers can process items provided beneath them
The Input items can be dropped or placed on a Depot under the Deployer
When items are provided on a belt...
The Deployer will hold and process them automatically
create_brass_coated.ponder.deployer_reds: When powered by Redstone, Deployers will not activate
Before stopping, the Deployer will finish any started cycles
Thus, a negative pulse can be used to trigger exactly one activation cycle
create_brass_coated.ponder.depot.text_1: Depots can serve as 'stationary' belt elements
create_brass_coated.ponder.depot.text_2: Right-Click to manually place or remove Items from it
create_brass_coated.ponder.depot.text_3: Just like Mechanical Belts, it can provide items to processing
create_brass_coated.ponder.depot.text_4: ...as well as provide Items to Mechanical Arms
create_brass_coated.ponder.fan_direction: Encased Fans use Rotational Force to create an Air Current
Strength and Direction of Flow depends on the Rotational Input
create_brass_coated.ponder.fan_processin: When passing through lava, the Air Flow becomes Heated
Items caught in the area will be smelted
Food items thrown here would be incinerated
Instead, a setup for Smoking using Fire should be used for them
Air Flows passing through water create a Washing Setup
Some interesting new processing can be done with it
The Speed of the Fan does NOT affect the processing speed, only its range
Fan Processing can also be applied to Items on Depots and Belts
create_brass_coated.ponder.gearbox.text_: Jumping between axes of rotation can get bulky quickly
A gearbox is the more compact equivalent of this setup
Shafts around corners rotate in mirrored directions
create_brass_coated.ponder.gearshift.hea: Controlling rotational force using a Gearshift
create_brass_coated.ponder.gearshift.tex: Gearshifts will relay rotation in a straight line
When powered by Redstone, it reverses the transmission
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_dr: Breaking Blocks with the Mechanical Drill
When given Rotational Force, a Mechanical Drill will break blocks directly in front of it
Its mining speed depends on the Rotational Input
Whenever Drills are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will break blocks the contraption runs them into
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_ha: Whenever Harvesters are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
They will harvest and reset any mature crops on their way
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_mi: Processing Items with the Mechanical Mixer
With a Mixer and Basin, some Crafting Recipes can be automated
Available recipes include any Shapeless Crafting Recipe, plus a couple extra ones
Some of those recipes may require the heat of a Blaze Burner
The filter slot can be used in case two recipes are conflicting.
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_pi: Mechanical Pistons can move blocks in front of them
Speed and direction of movement depend on the Rotational Input
Sticky Mechanical Pistons can pull the attached blocks back
Movement Modes of the Mechanical Piston
Whenever Pistons stop moving, the moved structure reverts to blocks
It can be configured never to revert to solid blocks, or only at the location it started at
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_pl: Whenever Ploughs are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will break blocks without a solid collision hitbox
...they can also launch entities without hurting them
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_pr: Processing Items with the Mechanical Press
The Mechanical Press can process items provided beneath it
The Input items can be dropped or placed on a Depot under the Press
When items are provided on a belt...
The Press will hold and process them automatically
Compacting items with the Mechanical Press
Pressing items held in a Basin will cause them to be Compacted
Compacting includes any filled 2x2 or 3x3 Crafting Recipe, plus a couple extra ones
Some of those recipes may require the heat of a Blaze Burner
The filter slot can be used in case two recipes are conflicting.
create_brass_coated.ponder.mechanical_sa: Cutting Trees with the Mechanical Saw
When given Rotational Force, a Mechanical Saw will cut trees directly in front of it
In order to cut the tree fully, the Saw has to break the last block connecting it to the ground
Whenever Saws are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will cut any trees the contraption runs them into
Processing Items on the Mechanical Saw
Upward facing Mechanical Saws can process a variety of items
The processed item always moves against the rotational input to the saw
Saws can work in-line with Mechanical Belts
When an ingredient has multiple possible outcomes, the filter slot can specify it
Without filter, the Saw would cycle through all outcomes instead
create_brass_coated.ponder.weighted_ejec: Using Weighted Ejectors
Sneak and Right-Click holding an Ejector to select its target location
It is now limited to this stack size, and only activates when its held stack reaches this amount
Other Entities will always trigger an Ejector when stepping on it
The placed ejector will now launch objects to the marked location
A valid target can be at any height or distance within range
They cannot however be off to a side
If no valid Target was selected, it will simply target the block directly in front
Supply Rotational Force in order to charge it up
Items placed on the ejector cause it to trigger
If Inventories are targeted, the ejector will wait until there is space
Using the Wrench, a required Stack Size can be configured
Controlling Weighted Ejectors with Redstone
When powered by Redstone, Ejectors will not activate
Furthermore, Observers can detect when Ejectors activate
Splitting item stacks using Weighted Ejectors
Combined with Brass Tunnels, Ejectors can split item stacks by specific amounts
First, configure the Brass Tunnel to 'Prefer Nearest', in order to prioritize its side output
The Stack Size set on the Ejector now determines the amount to be split off
While a new stack of the configured size exits the side output...
...the remainder will continue on its path
create_brass_coated.ponder.shared.behavi: This behaviour can be modified using a Wrench
create_brass_coated.ponder.shared.storag: Inventories attached to the Contraption will pick up their drops automatically
create_brass_coated.ponder.shared.moveme: With the help of Super Glue, larger structures can be moved.
create_brass_coated.ponder.clutch.header: Controlling rotational force using a Clutch
create_brass_coated.ponder.clutch.text_1: Clutches will relay rotation in a straight line
create_brass_coated.ponder.clutch.text_2: When powered by Redstone, it breaks the connection
create_brass_coated.ponder.chain_drive.h: Relaying rotational force with Chain Drives
create_brass_coated.ponder.chain_drive.t: Chain Drives relay rotation to each other in a row
All shafts connected like this will rotate in the same direction
Any part of the row can be rotated by 90 degrees
